Description: Souvenir mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a rayed cross; there is a nozzle-channel. The shoulder is decorated with branch-patterns and berries, within raised edges. Near the rear is a pierced handle. The underbody is decorated with a raised lattice-pattern with internal raised points. Under the nozzle is a branch. The base-ring encloses a raised cross and a pattern of raised points. Covered with brown paint, with black paint round the wick-hole and applied incrustation on top.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3430bis MLA)
